question: India's first underwater metro project is set to be launched in which city?
explanation:
Indiaâ€™s first underwater metro project, the East-West project of the Kolkata Metro Rail Corporation is set be launched by March 2022.
The metro project runs partly under the famous Hooghly river of Kolkata. The new line is expected to carry about 9 lakh people daily and will take less than a minute to cross the underwater tunnel of half a kilometre. Rs 41.6 billion was provided by Japan International Cooperation Agency to fund nearly half of the project. The East-West metro project is 74% owned by Union Railway Ministry of India and 26% by the Union Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs.
